availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James G Blunk (Louisville, Kentucky, resident, fisherman, and policeman)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident, fisherman, and policeman. Indiana native. Son of Dicy Blunk. Married to Amanda E. Birch in Louisville, Kentucky, on May 20, 1858. Father of Laura Blunk, Udora Blunk, William Blunk, and Erwina Blunk. Resident of Memphis, Tennessee, in 1850. Fisherman in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Policeman in Louisville, Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Shelby County, Memphis Ward 1, p. 2B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 590.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 12, p. 583B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482708.
"James G. Blunk (1832-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial 51707253, accessed November 30, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51707253.
